intro: Tibouchina alba, commonly known as white flamebush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Tibouchina alba thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
